intro: Trigonospora ciliata var. angustiloba, commonly known as the narrow-leafed trigonospora, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves with ciliate margins, giving it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers clustered in terminal inflorescences. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in tropical and subtropical regions. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticultural and ecological studies.
